intro: Scilla nelsonii, commonly known as Nelson's scilla, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its blue or violet bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in woodland habitats. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered blooms in early spring. Scilla nelsonii is often found in California and is considered a rare and endangered species.
